info.name: Gaia-X Organization Credential Manager
info.description:
## Overview

OCM (Organizational Credential Manager) is a Node.js-based microservice system designed to manage organizational credentials.

## Quick Start

### Clone the repository:

``` bash
git clone git@gitlab.eclipse.org:eclipse/xfsc/ocm/ocm-engine.git

 ```

### Start the stack using `docker-compose up -d` in the root of the project:

``` bash
cd ocm-engine
docker compose up -d

 ```

> **Note:** By default, this collection is configured to interact with services running locally (using Docker Compose or directly on the bare metal). If you wish to run the requests of this collection against the OCM stack hosted on a remote machine, you will need to create a new Postman Environment. 
  

### Initial Setup

In the "Integration" folder, execute all requests under the `Init` subfolder one-by-one. These are needed to "seed" the stack with some initial data and actors (tenants).

> You can use Postman's feature `Run Folder` for this. 
  

Once the `Init` step is done, execute the steps in the following folders in the order they are defined.

item.name: APIs

request.description: This call provides a list of schemas for a given tenant

This call provides the capability to create new schema on ledger by name, author, version, schema attributes and type. Later this schema can be used to issue new credential definition. This call returns an information about created schema.
This call allows you to retrieve schema data for a given tenant by specifying the `schemaId`.

item.name: Fetch a list of credential definitions

request.description: This call provides a list of credential definitions for a given tenant
This call allows you to create a credential definition for a given tenant

item.name: Fetch a credential definition by ID

request.description: This call provides a credential definition for a given tenant
This call provides a list of connections for a given tenant
This call creates a self connection for a given tenant
This call provides a connection for a given tenant and connection ID
This call blocks a connection for a given tenant and connection ID
This call creates a new invitation for a given tenant
This call receives an invitation for a given tenant
This call provides a list of credentials for a given tenant

variable.description: (Required) The credential record ID to retrieve

request.description: This call provides a credential for a given tenant
This call revokes a credential for a given tenant
This call deletes a credential for a given tenant

item.name: Fetch a list of credential offers

request.description: This call provides a list of credential offers for a given tenant
This call creates a credential offer for a given connection ID and credential definition ID

item.name: Fetch a credential offer by ID

variable.description: (Required) The credential offer ID to retrieve

request.description: This call provides a credential offer for a given ID

item.name: Create a credential offer to self

request.description: This call creates a credential offer for a given credential definition ID

variable.description: (Required) The credential offer ID to retrieve

request.description: This call accepts a credential offer for a given ID

item.name: Fetch a list of credential requests

request.description: This call provides a list of credential requests for a given tenant

item.name: Fetch a credential request by id

request.description: This call provides a credential request for a given tenant by id

item.name: Check if a credential can be reissued

request.description: Check if a credential can be reissued

item.name: Check if a credential should be revoked

request.description: Check if a credential should be revoked

item.name: Check if a credential should be refreshed

request.description: Check if a credential should be refreshed

item.name: Fetch a list of presentation proofs

request.description: This call provides a list of presentation proofs for a given tenant
This call requests a presentation proof for a given tenant

item.name: Fetch a presentation proof by id

request.description: This call provides a presentation proof for a given tenant and id
This call deletes a presentation proof for a given tenant
Resolve DID
Register DID from seed
Get DID configuration

item.description: This folder contains the documentation for the individual microservices of the Organization Credential Manager (OCM)

item.name: Integration
Init
item.description:
This folder contains a series of preliminary requests essential for execution before proceeding with the rest of the integration tests:

- Create a tenant named 'issuer'.
- Create a tenant named 'holder'.
- Create a tenant named 'verifier'.
- Create a public DID for the 'issuer'.

item.name: Create Schema and Credential Definition
Register a Credential Definition w/ Revocation

item.description: This folder demonstrates the functionality of creating a Schema and a Credential Definition, which are necessary for issuing credentials

item.name: Establish connections

exec: url: pm.collectionVariables.get('Connection Manager Base URL') + "/v1/connections?tenantId=" + pm.collectionVariables.get('issuer_id'),
url: pm.collectionVariables.get('Connection Manager Base URL') + "/v1/connections?tenantId=" + pm.collectionVariables.get('issuer_id'),

item.description:
Requests in this folder demonstrate the creation of connections between the actors of the Trust Triangle:

- Issuer  Holder: to demonstrate the process of credential issuance.
    
- Verifier  Issuer: to demonstrate the process of credential verification.
    
- Issuer  Issuer: to demonstrate the process of issuing a credential to oneself.

exec: url: pm.collectionVariables.get('Credential Manager Base URL') + "/v1/credential-offers?tenantId=" + pm.collectionVariables.get('holder_id'),
url: pm.collectionVariables.get('Credential Manager Base URL') + "/v1/credential-offers?tenantId=" + pm.collectionVariables.get('holder_id'),
url: pm.collectionVariables.get('Credential Manager Base URL') + "/v1/credential-offers?tenantId=" + pm.collectionVariables.get('holder_id'),
url: pm.collectionVariables.get('Credential Manager Base URL') + "/v1/credentials?tenantId=" + pm.collectionVariables.get('issuer_id'),
url: pm.collectionVariables.get('Credential Manager Base URL') + "/v1/credential-offers?tenantId=" + pm.collectionVariables.get('holder_id'),
// Store new credential id on Issuer's side
url: pm.collectionVariables.get('Credential Manager Base URL') + "/v1/credentials?tenantId=" + pm.collectionVariables.get('issuer_id'),
url: pm.collectionVariables.get('Proof Manager Base URL') + "/v1/proofs?tenantId=" + pm.collectionVariables.get('holder_id'),
url: pm.collectionVariables.get('Proof Manager Base URL') + "/v1/proofs?tenantId=" + pm.collectionVariables.get('holder_id'),
url: pm.collectionVariables.get('Connection Manager Base URL') + "/v1/connections?tenantId=" + pm.collectionVariables.get('issuer_id'),
url: pm.collectionVariables.get('Connection Manager Base URL') + "/v1/connections?tenantId=" + pm.collectionVariables.get('issuer_id'),

item.description: This folder is designed to house a comprehensive series of requests aimed at conducting end-to-end testing for all APIs
